content.question: Which of the following accurately describes a model of active transport?

choices.label: A membrane channel protein facilitates the movement of molecules from an area of high concentration on the outside of the cell to an area of lower concentration on the inside.
A cell in a hypotonic solution swells as water moves into it.
A membrane protein binds a specific molecule outside of the cell and moves the molecule into the cell where there is already a high concentration of the molecule compared with the outside.
A membrane protein binds a specific molecule on the inside of the cell and moves the molecule to an area of lower concentration on the outside of the cell.

content.answer: A membrane protein binds a specific molecule outside of the cell and moves the molecule into the cell where there is already a high concentration of the molecule compared with the outside.
